definition: to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
to be afraid/to fear/to dread/to be unable to endure/perhaps

sentences.english: And when he looked on him, he was afraid, and said, What is it, Lord?
sentences.chinese: 哥尼流定睛看他，驚怕說，主阿，什麼事呢。

sentences.english: They were frightened but did not feel any pain at first.
sentences.chinese: 起初他們只感到驚怕，並不覺痛。

sentences.english: But they were too terrified to fall asleep.
sentences.chinese: 但是，他們驚怕得都入睡不了。

sentences.english: Young people must learn to face challenges calmly.
sentences.chinese: 年輕人面對挫折不必驚怕，要學會鎮定。

sentences.english: The void shall not weary, the fear shall not alter.
sentences.chinese: 單調不會令他們厭倦，驚怕也不會改變。

sentences.english: I have ever experienced death, I did not afraid.
sentences.chinese: 我曾經經歷死亡，我沒有驚怕。

sentences.english: Then suddenly, right in front of me, was my worst nightmare.
sentences.chinese: 接着，突然正在我前方出現了我最驚怕的惡夢。

sentences.english: Nothing takes him by surprise and he will bring you through.
sentences.chinese: 沒有東西是可以令神驚怕的，祂必然帶領你經過一切。
